head.title: FAQ – Sport Track Merger
head.description: Have a question about the Sport Track Merger app? Here are the answers to the most frequently asked questions about merging or duplicating Strava activities.

faq.title: FAQ
faq.description: Here are the most frequently asked questions from users.
faq.footer: Can’t find the answer to your question?

questions.question: What is Sport Track Merger for?
questions.answer: The app allows you to merge or duplicate Strava activities to fix a GPS bug, group commutes, or combine several days of adventure into a single activity.

questions.question: What is the difference between the free version and the Pro version?
questions.answer: The free version allows you to merge up to 2 activities, twice a day. The Pro version offers unlimited merges, full customization (title, description, activity type, etc.), and access to more than your last 50 activities.

questions.question: Do I need a credit card to activate the trial version?
questions.answer: No, the trial version is completely free and does not require a credit card. You can activate it directly in the app.

questions.question: I’m changing phones. Will I lose my Pro version?
questions.answer: No, your Pro purchase is linked to your Strava account. Just log in with the same account on your new phone to restore your Pro access at no extra cost.

questions.question: Can I merge an activity with GPS data on one side and heart rate on the other?
questions.answer: Yes, Sport Track Merger can merge overlapping activities, for example to combine GPS data with heart rate or power sensor data.

questions.question: How does activity duplication work?
questions.answer: You can duplicate an existing activity by choosing a new date and time. This is useful for correcting a recording error, for instance.

questions.question: Can I recover my GPX or TCX file after merging?
questions.answer: The app automatically deletes GPX or TCX files from your phone after merging to save space. However, you can always export the merged activity from Strava.

questions.question: Why does my merged activity show more distance than the total of the originals?
questions.answer: If the end and start points of your merged activities don’t match, Strava automatically adds a connecting segment. A fix for this is currently being developed.

questions.question: Why is my merged activity marked as a 'Workout' on Strava?
questions.answer: The free version does not allow editing the activity type. With the Pro version, the activity type is automatically set based on the merged activities.

questions.question: My new Strava activity shows incorrect PRs. What should I do?
questions.answer: Make sure you deleted the original activities after merging. If PRs are still wrong, click 'Recalculate Efforts' in the Strava app.

questions.question: Why does the app request access to my Strava activities?
questions.answer: The app needs access to your Strava activities to read, merge, and create new ones. No data is sent to external servers — everything is handled locally on your device.

questions.question: How is my personal data handled?
questions.answer: Your data is processed locally on your device. No activity is stored on external servers. See our privacy policy for more information.

questions.question: How can I change the app's language, theme, units, or date format?
questions.answer: You can change these settings in the app settings. Tap your profile picture to access them.
